meanings.definition: A person or thing that deforms.
meanings.sent1: The deformer accidentally bent the toy out of shape.
meanings.sent2: The plastic deformer altered the clay figure's appearance.
meanings.sent3: The deformer, a mischievous puppy, chewed on the edges of the book.
meanings.sent4: His careless handling of the sculpture turned him into a deformer of art.
meanings.sent5: The deformer's touch left a lasting mark on the delicate material.

meanings.definition: To distort the shape or form of something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not deformer the paper by crumpling it.
meanings.sent2: The heat began to deformer the plastic cup on the table.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to deformer the balloon into a funny shape.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to deformer the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The artist intentionally deformer the painting to create a unique effect.

meanings.definition: To change the appearance or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The new paint color will deformer the room's look completely.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the sun can deformer the surface of the wooden bench.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to deformer the traditional recipe by adding a new ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to deformer his perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: The architect's innovative design will deformer the skyline of the city.
